拖.definition: to drag; to tow; to trail; to hang down; to mop (the floor); to delay; to drag on

拖下水.definition: lit. to pull sb into the water; to involve sb in a messy business; to get sb into trouble

拖人下水.definition: lit. to pull sb into the water; fig. to involve sb in a messy business; to get sb into trouble

拖住.definition: to hold up; to hinder; to stall

拖兒帶女.definition: supporting a wife and children; dragged down by having a family to feed

拖動.definition: to drag; to tow; (computing) to drag (mouse operation)

拖地.definition: to mop the floor; (of a gown etc) to trail on the ground; full-length

拖垮.definition: to drag down; to bring down

拖堂.definition: to drag out a lesson; to insist on extending class after the bell

拖家帶口.definition: dragged down by having a family to feed

拖尾巴.definition: to obstruct; to be a drag on sb; to delay finishing off a job

拖延.definition: to delay; to put off; to procrastinate

拖延時間.definition: to procrastinate; to stall for time; to filibuster

拖後腿.definition: to impede; to obstruct; to hold back

拖慢.definition: to retard; to slow sth down

拖拉.definition: to drag along; to haul; (fig.) to procrastinate; shilly-shallying; sluggish; (computing) drag and drop; (loanword) tola, unit of weight, approx. 11.664 grams

拖拽.definition: to pull; to drag; to haul

拖曳.definition: to pull; to drag; to haul

拖欠.definition: in arrears; behind in payments; to default on one's debts

拖歐.definition: to go through a difficult and protracted process in withdrawing from the EU, as in the case of Brexit (a play on 脫歐|脱欧[tuo1 Ou1])

拖油瓶.definition: (derog.) (of a woman) to bring one's children into a second marriage; children by a previous marriage

拖泥帶水.definition: (idiom) muddy and wet; (idiom) (of speech, writing etc) slovenly; sloppy; (of actions) indecisive

拖累.definition: to encumber; to be a burden on; to implicate

拖船.definition: tugboat; boat towed by a tugboat; to tow a boat

拖車.definition: to tow; towed vehicle; towing vehicle

拖鏈.definition: cable carrier (used to protect cables and hoses attached to a machine); tow chain

拖雷.definition: Tolui (1193-1232), fourth son of Genghis Khan

拖鞋.definition: slippers; sandals; flip-flops; CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
